title: Manufacturing Consent: Chomsky's Media Model
description: A quick, practical guide to Manufacturing Consent: Chomsky's Media Model.

hook.text: Noam Chomsky argued that 'free press' in democracies still produces propaganda â€” just through economics, not censorship.

buildup.text: The propaganda model has five filters: ownership, advertising, sourcing, flak (pushback), and ideology.

discovery.text: When six corporations own 90% of media, their business interests shape what stories get told â€” and which don't.

twist.text: Critics say Chomsky oversimplifies: journalists do push back, independent media exists, and audiences aren't passive.

climax.text: The model's core insight endures: follow the money. Who pays for media shapes what it produces, in any political system.

punchline.text: Free press doesn't mean free from influence. Follow the money.
